intro: Galium chloroleucum, commonly known as white wood-sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine white hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium chloroleucum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological value to pollinators.
